page.title: 09Fife Folk Museum, Ceres
page.content: In 1968 the Museum opened to the public and in 1970 the Central and North Fife Preservation Society bought an adjacent building and the Museum expanded. Most of the exhibits have been donated by residents of Fife and date from the Stone Age right through to the nineteenth century. Generally, the Museum gives an impression of rural life over the last two hundred years. An outstanding feature of the Museum is a scene depicting domestic life in a Fife village in the eighteenth century. At the rear of the building many old farming implements are displayed. Over the last decade attendances have varied between 4000 and 8000 per year.
